Label: Entity
Definition: A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity

Label: Legal Entity
Definition: A human or non-human 'thing' that constitutes as an entity and which is recognised and defined in law

Label: Representative
Definition: A representative of a legal entity
Usage: A representative may not be a 'legal agent' if it is authorised to only represent the entity and not to take actions on its behalf
Contributors: Georg P. Krog, Paul Ryan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Beatriz Esteves

Label: Public Register
Definition: A register containing information which is made publicly available, such as to list organisations belonging to a particular sector, or for data available

Label: Public Register of Entities
Definition: A publicly available list of entities e.g. to indicate which entities perform a certain activity within a certain location or jurisdiction

Label: Subsidiary Legal Entity
Definition: A legal entity that operates as a subsidiary of another legal entity
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Parent Legal Entity
Definition: A legal entity that has one or more subsidiary entities operating under it
Contributors: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P. Krog

Label: Agent
Definition: An Agent is a dpv:Entity that is (a) acting on behalf of another Entity; and (b) is authorised to do so by that Entity
Usage: the Entity the Agent is acting on behalf of can be a human or non-human and a legal or non-legal entity. For specific distinction, see dpv:LegalAgent and tech:MachineAgent. The form and validity of authorisation through which the Agent is empowered to represent and act on behalf of the Entity is not defined or covered in this concept

Label: Legal Agent
Definition: A Legal Agent is a Legal Entity that is authorised to act on behalf of another entity
Usage: Legal agents may be human or non-human (e.g. an organisation), but they must be 'legal persons' i.e. recognised by law as such. The agency and the mechanisms through which it is given, acquired, or expressed is governed by relevant jurisdictional frameworks e.g. power of attorney
